meanings.definition: To make a small firework that burns with a hissing sound before exploding.
meanings.sent1: During the celebration, they squibbed colorful fireworks into the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The kids squibbed sparklers at the birthday party.
meanings.sent3: Tom accidentally squibbed a firework into the cake, creating a surprising display.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks artist squibbed the night with bursts of light and color.
meanings.sent5: The squibbed fireworks lit up the dark sky like a painting come to life.

meanings.definition: To write or create something quickly and without much effort.
meanings.sent1: She squibbed a short story for the school magazine.
meanings.sent2: The student squibbed a poem during the class assignment.
meanings.sent3: In a rush, he squibbed a thank-you note on a napkin.
meanings.sent4: The author squibbed a novel in just a week.
meanings.sent5: Her squibbed drawing captured the essence of the scene effortlessly.

meanings.definition: To fail to meet expectations or perform adequately.
meanings.sent1: Despite practicing, he squibbed his performance on stage.
meanings.sent2: The team squibbed the game due to lack of coordination.
meanings.sent3: The chef squibbed the dish, leaving the customers disappointed.
meanings.sent4: Her presentation squibbed, lacking the necessary details.
meanings.sent5: The project squibbed, missing the mark and falling short of success.
